list.description: 50 W. 300 South, Salt Lake City
220 with tables, 300 without
Street parking

Cafe sells food including appetizers, salads, sandwiches, soups, tacos, desserts and breakfast served all day. Vegetarian and gluten-free options are also available. Beverages sold include soda, tea, juice and Monster energy drinks. Catering allowed for events. No outside alcohol allowed.
Security personnel on-site when the bar is open (bar open upon request for events). Weapons and other dangerous items prohibited.
50westslc.com
123 W. South Temple, Salt Lake City
2,700 seats

Nearby paid parking garages include City Creek Parking (entrances on South Temple, 100 South, State Street and West Temple), the Parking Place (located at North Temple and 300 West with entrances also available on South Temple and 200 West), Salt Lake Plaza Hotel (122 W. South Temple) and Downtown Marriott (75 S. West Temple). Salt Lake County Center for the Arts provides additional parking information on its website.
Concessions and alcohol sold. Only water is allowed in the performance hall. No outside food or beverage allowed.

Security personnel are on-site during events. Depending on the event, heightened security measures may be put in place. Weapons and other dangerous items prohibited. Call for specific questions about prohibited items.
artsaltlake.org
124 S. 400 West, Salt Lake City
South Parking Garage at The Gateway. Entrance to the venue is located on 400 West, just south of Clark Planetarium. The first hour of parking is free, and parking is free all day on Sunday.

Offers beverages including beer, soda, water and light concessions for public events. Private events are allowed to bring in their own food/catering and provide a full bar to their guests under current state laws and DABC restrictions.
Guests may not bring in any illegal substances or weapons.
theacousticspace.com
Hosts concerts and private events. Also has a vocal coaching service for singers, actors, voice overs, public speaking, expressive communication, presentations and oral proposals.
451 S. 400 West, Salt Lake City
Street and parking lot parking, according to the venue’s Facebook page.
Offers a bar and a kitchen that is open Friday-Saturday, 9 p.m.- 2 a.m.
Basic security. Guarded parking. Ladies walked to cars off property.
area51slc.com
Functions as a typical nightclub, but sometimes also has live bands and touring DJs. The venue encourages guests to carpool and arrive early.
Temple Square, 50 W. North Temple, Salt Lake City

Closest parking is at City Creek Center or the Joseph Smith Memorial Building (15 E. South Temple, Salt Lake City — head westbound to access underground parking located in the center of South Temple. Turn right at the bottom of the ramp. Parking is $10, but all four Temple Square restaurants offer customers a three-hour validation. Events in the Joseph Smith Memorial Building and Lion House also validate parking).
Food and beverage prohibited.
Security on-site at Temple Square.
lds.org
645 S. State, Salt Lake City

Parking lot on the south side of the building. If that lot is full, additional parking is available in the lot south of The Bayou’s after 5 p.m. Street parking is free after 6 p.m., and parking is also available on 600 and 700 South just east of State Street.

Beer bar and Cajun restaurant that sells appetizers, pizzas, sandwiches, soups, salads, pasta, entrees and desserts. Kitchen remains open Tuesday-Saturday until 12:30 a.m. and Sunday-Monday until 12 a.m. No outside food or beverage allowed.
utahbayou.com

For adults 21 years of age or older. Must have a valid form of ID to enter. The Bayou is strictly a jazz and blues venue and has live jazz and blues three nights a week. Bands usually start at 9 p.m. and play through last call.
2801 S. Decker Lake Drive, West Valley City
971zht.iheart.com
Located at the 97.1 ZHT music production studio
445 S. 400 West, Salt Lake City
clubxslc.com
Live music concert venue, according to website.
536 W. 100 South, Salt Lake City
850; events are typically general admission and all standing

Nearby parking includes The Gateway (discounted all-day parking vouchers available at The Complex concessions counter for $5); street parking available along 100 South and 600 West, but The Complex warns to be cautious of the clearly marked no parking zones.
A concessions area in the lobby serves food, snacks, soda and energy drinks. A 21-and-older bar mezzanine is at the back of the room. No outside food or beverage is allowed.

The Complex does not allow weapons of any kind, drugs or drug paraphernalia, professional photography, markers or pens, gum, or bags bigger than a purse. All patrons are subject to search. According to the venue’s website, “patrons who are clearly intoxicated or under the influence of drugs will not be admitted.”
thecomplexslc.com

title: David Gardner Hall - Dumke Recital Hall

list.description: David Gardner Hall, 1375 Presidents Circle, Salt Lake City
114 seats

Free parking available at the Rice-Eccles Stadium parking lot and, for select concerts, the North Parking Garage. A parking terrace at 100 South and Wolcott is also available, but there will be a charge to park in this lot for some performances. Shuttles provided for Virtuoso Series, Chamber Music Society, gala and scholarship concerts, starting at 6:30 p.m. and departing every 10 minutes.
Food and beverage prohibited. Alcohol is not allowed in the building.
No flash photography or recording.
University of Utah School of Music, 801-581-6762; Kingsbury Hall box office, 801-581-7100
music.utah.edu

title: David Gardner Hall - Libby Gardner Concert Hall

list.description: David Gardner Hall, 1375 Presidents Circle, Salt Lake City
680 seats, plus choir seating for 200 performers. The stage can accommodate over 80 musicians.

Free parking available at the Rice-Eccles Stadium parking lot and, for select concerts, the North Parking Garage. A parking terrace at 100 South and Wolcott is also available, but there will be a charge to park in this lot for some performances. Shuttles provided for Virtuoso Series, Chamber Music Society, gala and scholarship concerts, starting at 6:30 p.m. and departing every 10 minutes.
Food and beverage prohibited. Alcohol is not allowed in the building.
No flash photography or recording.
University of Utah School of Music, 801-581-6762; Kingsbury Hall box office, 801-581-7100
music.utah.edu

title: David Gardner Hall - Thompson Chamber Music Hall

list.description: David Gardner Hall, 1375 Presidents Circle, Salt Lake City
Flexible seating for up to 250 for concerts, banquets or receptions

Free parking available at the Rice-Eccles Stadium parking lot and, for select concerts, the North Parking Garage. Shuttles provided for Virtuoso Series, Chamber Music Society, gala and scholarship concerts, starting at 6:30 p.m. and departing every 10 minutes.
Food from approved caterers allowed. Alcohol is not allowed in the building.
No flash photography or recording.
University of Utah School of Music, 801-581-6762; Kingsbury Hall box office, 801-581-7100

Basic bar food items are available, including pizza, cheese sticks, chicken tenders, etc. No outside food or beverage.
Security guards on-site. Prohibited items include weapons, drugs, detachable lens cameras, GoPros, selfie sticks, iPads, wallet chains and spiked jewelry or belts.

Music Venue is The Depot’s main concert venue. The Depot is 21+ venue unless otherwise stated for certain shows.

2,500 seats

Nearby paid parking garages include the Regent Street Garage (55 E. 200 South), City Creek Parking (entrances on South Temple, 100 South, State Street and West Temple), Gallivan Center (201 S. Main) and Wells Fargo Building (299 S. Main). Salt Lake County Center for the Arts provides additional parking information on its website.

Alcohol is available for sale. Beer is sold at the concessions stands, and a full bar is available in the Encore Bistro in the lobby. All alcohol sales are both pre-show and during intermission. Any alcohol purchased in the Encore Bistro must be consumed there and may not be taken into the lobby or the theater. Food items sold at the Eccles Theater concessions stands may be eaten in the theater. No outside food or beverage.

Security personnel are on-site during events. Depending on the event, heightened security measures may be put in place. Weapons and other dangerous items prohibited. Call for specific questions about prohibited items.
artsaltlake.org

list.description: 131 S. Main, Salt Lake City
145 seats

Main) and Wells Fargo Building (299 S. Main). Salt Lake County Center for the Arts provides additional parking information on its website.

Alcohol is available for sale. Beer is sold at the concessions stands, and a full bar is available in the Encore Bistro in the lobby. All alcohol sales are both pre-show and during intermission. Serves dinner and drinks. Three full-service bars.

Nightclub that hosts concerts and private events. Dressy attire.
580 S. 600 East, Salt Lake City
Underground parking available in garage on 600 South on P2 level and elsewhere at Trolley Square.
Open to vendors for private events.
Security personnel patrol Trolley Square, and hosting staff is present at events.
thefallseventcenter.com
Hosts concerts and private events.
239 S. Main, Salt Lake City
7,000 general admission

Parking options include Ampco Parking at 30 E. 200 South (below the Gallivan Center), Walker Center Parking at 175 S. Main (north of the Gallivan Center) and Wells Fargo Parking at 70 E. 300 South (south of the Gallivan Center).
The Gallivan Center does not sell food or beverage. Food trucks may be invited for some events.

Each event is different but in general, the Gallivan Center does not allow dogs (except service animals), weapons or alcohol. Sometimes coolers, food and water are allowed, but it’s best to check with the office to find out for sure by calling 801-535-6110.
thegallivancenter.com
1199 N. Beck Street, Salt Lake City
98 with door closed, 298 with door open
Street (free), private lot. Parking is limited, so the venue recommends traveling there via Lyft or Uber.

Full kitchen and bar. The Grille sells entrees, sides, sandwiches, burgers, salads, soup, starters and ice cream sandwiches. Offers brunch on Saturdays and Sundays. Outside food and alcohol prohibited.
Security personnel on-site during concerts.
garageonbeck.com
326 S. West Temple, Salt Lake City
Street parking. City and public parking free after 8 p.m. Paid parking lot next door is privately owned and not associated with Gracie’s.
Bar and grill/full food menu. Must be 21 or older for bar entry. Offers lunch and dinner every day, brunch on Saturday and Sunday. No outside food or beverage allowed, except cakes for celebrations.
Security at the door. No confetti, firearms or other weapons allowed.
graciesslc.com

title: The Grand America Hotel - Lobby Lounge

list.description: 555 S. Main, Salt Lake City

Self-parking and valet parking are available. Underground parking is offered for self-parking; accessible from both the Main Street and 600 South entrances. Daily valet is $10 and daily event parking is complimentary for the first 30 minutes, then $3 an hour up to three hours and $1 for each additional hour after three hours. Daily maximum $20. A coupon or credit card is required to exit the parking garage, no cash accepted at the gate.
Serves afternoon tea and an all-day light fare menu including appetizers, soups, salads and sandwiches, as well as coffee, tea, soft drinks, alcohol and cocktails. No outside food or drink allowed.
Security cameras monitored. Security personnel occasionally on-site for high-profile performers.
grandamerica.com
Live jazz on weekend nights.
63 Exchange Place, Salt Lake City
Street parking, also available at parking garage next door.

No food or beverage sold at The Heavy Metal Shop, but guests can purchase food from surrounding vendors and bring it into the venue. No alcohol allowed. The Heavy Metal Shop occasionally hosts food trucks.
Security personnel on-site for concerts. No weapons allowed.
heavymetalshop.com
Hosts all-ages events.
219 S. 600 West, Salt Lake City

Suggested parking would be along 600 West or paid parking at The Gateway. The lot to the south of the building is owned by the City of Salt Lake. It has posted no parking signs and fencing, and they will ticket/tow cars.
Bar. A current federal or state issued photo ID is required for bar entry. Outside food and drink commonly prohibited.

No weapons of any kind will be permitted. Drugs or any other illegal substances are not permitted. Guests are expected to maintain reasonable and appropriate behavior at all times. Each show has a specific outline for prohibited items and a unique set of rules written into its contract. All guests, bags and jackets are subject to search at any time. Common prohibited items include weapons, drugs, tasers, laser pointers, outside food or drink, professional camera equipment and writing utensils (pens, pencils and markers).
inthevenueslc.com
All-ages venue.
26 E. 600 South, Salt Lake City
1,700 in larger ballroom, 500 in smaller ballroom
Large paid lot west of the building across Main Street, just south of the Little America Hotel.
Concessions sold. Food and beverage available depends on the catering of each event. Outside food or beverage is allowed.
Security personnel is always on-site for concerts. Everything dangerous is prohibited, including weapons, drugs, underage drinking, etc.
infinityeventcenter.com
Hosts private events.
50 W. 200 South, Salt Lake City
1,790 seats

Nearby parking paid garages include the Salt Palace (200 S. West Temple), American Plaza Garage (51 W. 200 South), Ampco 175 Garage (175 S. West Temple) and Hotel Monaco (15 W. 200 South). Salt Lake County Center for the Arts provides additional parking information on its website.
Concessions and alcohol available for purchase both pre-show and during intermission. Only water is allowed in the theater. No outside food or beverage allowed.

Security personnel are on-site during events. Depending on the event, heightened security measures may be put in place. Weapons and other dangerous items prohibited. Call for specific questions about prohibited items.
artsaltlake.org
165 E. 200 South, Salt Lake City
About 150
Street parking
Serves appetizers, sandwiches and seasonal items, as well as beer and liquor. Outside food allowed, but outside drinks prohibited.
Security personnel on-site for concerts. Weapons of any sort are prohibited.
johnnysonsecond.com
Live music every Friday.
242 S. Main, Salt Lake City
Street parking or nearby paid parking garages
Offers a full bar and “light bar fare,” including wings, quesadillas, nachos and personal pizzas. Outside food and drink is prohibited.
Security personnel on-site every night. Open containers prohibited.
keysonmain.com
Everyone must be 21 or older to enter, no exceptions.
741 S. Kilby Court, Salt Lake City
It’s best to park on the street (700 South) and walk up the alleyway, or you may find a spot along the side of the street, according to Kilby Court’s website.
Soda, water, candy and snacks sold. Kilby Court does not sell alcohol. No outside beverages or alcohol is allowed.
Occasionally has security staff on hand. Prohibited items include alcohol, guns, knives, etc.
List of contacts on website.
kilbycourt.com
All-ages venue.
1395 Presidents Circle, Salt Lake City

Free parking is always available. Call the box office for times and locations. A parking terrace at 100 South and Wolcott is available, but there will be a charge to park in this lot for some performances. Free parking is available for all Kingsbury Hall events at either Rice-Eccles Stadium or Merrill Engineering Building. Check the performance page of the event you are attending for details. Meters are available along Presidents Circle. Most are free after 6 p.m. on nights with public performances at Kingsbury Hall but fill up fast. Most E, U and A lots are free on weekends and after 8 p.m. on weekdays, but look for signage at each lot to be sure. ADA parking is available directly east of Kingsbury Hall. Enter from Presidents Circle. For many events, Kingsbury Hall provides a shuttle service that goes directly to Kingsbury Hall from the Rice Eccles Stadium lot (or the Merrill Engineering lot) and back. Shuttle info is listed if you click the event you are attending on the calendar listings. Shuttles begin operating one hour prior to performance times and immediately following the performance. The shuttle does not operate on a specific schedule and departs from Kingsbury Hall or the stadium when it is more than half full.
No outside food or drink, concessions are for sale and allowed in the auditorium.
No flash photography or recording. No open carry permitted on University of Utah campus. Please contact Kingsbury Hall directly for event specific restrictions.
University of Utah School of Music, 801-581-6762; Kingsbury Hall box office, 801-581-7100
kingsburyhall.utah.edu
60 W. North Temple

There is no event parking available in the Conference Center parking for events in the main auditorium. Parking for events at the Conference Center is usually available at the Parking Place (located at North Temple and 300 West with entrances also available on South Temple and 200 West), the Triad Center (95 N. 300 West), Eagle Gate Terrace (entrance on Social Hall Avenue) and Regent Street Garage (55 E. 200 South). Disability parking is available at the lot on the corner of West Temple and North Temple. Paid parking is available at City Creek Parking (entrances on South Temple, 100 South, State Street and West Temple).
Food and beverage is not permitted. Water is allowed in clear, plastic water bottles only.

Screenings are common at any major Conference Center event. No weapons are allowed. According to information provided LDS Church public affairs, ticket holders consent to a reasonable inspection for contraband items upon entering the venue.
lds.org

According to LDS.org, seating for events in the Conference Center begins 90 minutes before the event starts, and those with tickets should be in their seats 30 minutes before the event start time. Standby seating is available on a first-come, first-served basis.
1249 E. 3300 South, Salt Lake City
About 400
Parking lot
Offers a full bar and wings, pizza, hot dogs and sausages, nachos, sides and egg rolls. Outside food and beverage is prohibited.
Security personnel on-site. Weapons and other dangerous items prohibited.
liquidjoes.net
445 S. 400 West, Salt Lake City
Parking lot
The Loading Dock does not sell food or beverage. Outside food and drink is allowed. Alcohol prohibited.
No weapons or drugs allowed.
loadingdockslc.com
All-ages venue.
3200 S. Decker Lake Drive, West Valley City

The Maverik Center has its own designated parking lots. Parking lots A, B and C are located on the grounds of the Maverik Center, while Parking Lot D is located adjacent to the Maverik Center at the corner of 3100 South and Decker Lake Drive. Parking is available on a first-come, first-served basis and is subject to a fee of $10 per vehicle for most events. Guests with a Mark Miller Subaru license plate cover can park for free at all events. Premium parking in the northeast lot allows patrons to exit the parking lot more quickly as well as enter the Maverik Center through a private entrance way and costs $25 via smithstix.com or pay cash at the lot, space permitting.

Concessions sold. Alcoholic beverages are sold at most Maverik Center events. In order to purchase alcohol inside the facility, each person 21 years and older must obtain a wristband at stations located throughout the facility by presenting a valid ID. Outside food and beverage of any kind is not allowed.

Security personnel on-site. Prohibited items include weapons of any kind, long chains and studded spikes (some jewelry subject to these guidelines as well), fireworks, illegal drugs, bottles, cans, coolers, audio or recording equipment of any kind, laser pointers, aerosol cans and noise makers, backpacks or any other oversized bags, laptops and umbrellas. Other items may be added to this list without notice. Service animals are permitted inside the facility and must remain on a leash or harness at all times.
maverikcenter.com
615 W. 100 South, Salt Lake City
600, standing venue
The Metro Music Hall has a small lot on the east side of the venue, and there are many parking spots along 100 South. Additional parking can also be found at The Gateway.
Full service bar. No outside food or drink is allowed.
Security is usually at Metro Music Hall. Guests cannot bring in weapons or outside alcohol.
metromusichall.com
21+ age restriction.
1989 S. 1100 East Suite A, Salt Lake City
About 50 parking stalls are available behind the building.
No food or beverage sold. Alcohol prohibited. Venue usually gives out water during shows.
Security personnel on-site during shows. Illegal items prohibited, as well as weapons and things of that nature.
palehorsesound.com
All-ages venue.
242 S. 200 West, Salt Lake City
About 300
Limited spots available in front parking lot. Otherwise, street parking.
Bar and grill serves appetizers, pizza, burgers, beer and cocktails. Also offers Sunday brunch. No outside food or beverage allowed.
Security personnel on-site for performances. Weapons prohibited, as well as other items typically not allowed in a bar.
poplarstreetpub.com
2155 Red Butte Canyon Road, Salt Lake City
3,000; seating is general admission on a first-come, first-served basis
Parking lot is free but limited. The venue encourages visitors to bike, carpool or take public transportation. Free bike valet is provided by the Salt Lake City Bicycle Collective.
Food and nonalcoholic beverages available for sale. Burgers, sandwiches, wraps, salads, snacks and sweets sold. Guests are allowed to bring a cooler and pack picnics. No cooking or barbecues allowed.

No weapons allowed except as expressly permitted by law. Recording and transmission at concerts is generally prohibited. Cameras with removable lenses, video cameras and recording devices are prohibited. No flash photography. At some shows, photography will not be allowed at all. Service animals are the only animals allowed inside Red Butte Garden and Amphitheatre. Participants are expected to conduct themselves in an orderly fashion and to refrain from conduct and language that would be offensive and/or disruptive to performers or other event participants. Participants who violate these rules may be ejected from the event, according to the venue’s website.
redbuttegarden.org/concerts

501 seats

Saturday nights, there is a dress code — no hats, sweatshirts, graphics, chains or baggy clothes allowed.
638 S. State, Salt Lake City

300. The State Room features a mix of fixed seats, tables and chairs, and open floor space. For some shows, floor seating or cabaret seating is available on a first-come, first-serve basis. All tickets are general admission.

Diamond Parking controls the lot immediately south of The State Room’s building, and it costs $3 to park in that lot. There is also plenty of street parking available, but The State Room encourages visitors to observe all parking regulations and meters.
The State Room offers a full bar and some snacks. Private events may hire caterers. No outside food or drink is permitted inside the venue.
Security personnel on-site for concerts. Weapons and other dangerous items prohibited. The State Room has a no flash photography and video recording policy.
Concert line, 800-501-2885; box office, 801-596-3560
thestateroom.com
The State Room is a 21 and over venue.

There is currently no kitchen at the Tavernacle Social Club, but there are neighboring restaurants that can deliver orders. Outside food is allowed, but no outside beverage is allowed.
Security on-site. Weapons prohibited.

Reservations are encouraged online or by phone at least a couple days in advance for Weekend Dueling Piano Shows and parties larger than 10 during the week.

3,500, standing room only
Secured and monitored parking lot at 510 W. 300 North (behind Diamond Mattress) with a $5 fee.
Full bar, in-house kitchen and concessions stand. Outside food and beverage is not allowed.
Security personnel on-site for concerts. Guests are not allowed to bring in weapons/hazardous materials, glass or metal containers, recording devices or large bags.
facebook.com/TheRailEventCenter
Formerly known as “The Rail Event Center.” All-ages venue (all ages on main floor, 21+ on second floor).
241 S. 500 East
295 people, events are general admission and standing, but booth rental available or a limited number of tables and stools are available on a first-come, first-served basis
Parking is available on a first-come, first-served basis in front of the venue and in a small lot behind the building. Additional parking is available along 200 South.
Food, beverages and alcohol are available for purchase. No outside food or beverage is permitted.

No firearms, drugs or other items that could potentially harm another person are permitted. Depending on the show, patrons may be subject to pat downs, bag checks and checks with a metal detector wand.
theurbanloungeslc.com
Only patrons ages 21 and older are permitted in the venue.
5150 Upper Ridge Road, West Valley City
20,000 people in 13,000 lawn seats and 7,000 reserved seats. Some events are general admission.
Parking is available on a first-come, first-served basis and is included with the price of a ticket. Premium parking is $20 per car.

Multiple food and beverage vendors are available on-site. No outside food or drink permitted. Alcohol is served at the Blue Moon Public House on the south concourse of the venue for patrons 21 and older and must be consumed there.

All patrons are subject to search. Items such as inflatable chairs, backpacks, fireworks, strollers, glass, cans, plastic bottles, coolers, umbrellas, weapons, wallet chains and spiked bracelets and belts are prohibited.
usana-amp.com
Blankets and stadium seats with no legs are permitted for use in the lawn seating area.
301 W. South Temple
20,000 seats

Nearby paid parking includes the Parking Place (located at North Temple and 300 West with entrances also available on South Temple and 200 West), the Triad Center (95 N. 300 West) and The Gateway. See the Vivint Arena’s website for additional information.

Vivint Arena does not allow outside alcohol, but alcoholic beverages can be purchased inside the arena by patrons ages 21 and older with the proper ID. Alcohol sales stop 45 minutes before the end of the event. Vivint Arena houses multiple food vendors and allows food and drink inside the arena but does not allow outside food or drink.

Vivint Arena prohibits items such as firearms, knives, weapons of any kind, laser pointers, mace, pepper spray, selfie sticks and umbrellas. A list of additional prohibited items is available on the arena’s website. Guests must pass through metal detectors before entering the venue.
vivintarena.com
